snippet: Sticker shock. Remember that? When cars that cost 4 grand one year seemed to jump to 14 grand the next? All old hat now; a car -- a real car -- goes for $20,000 or more. Anything below that is just transportation.    O.K., then, are you ready for ...
lead_paragraph: Sticker shock. Remember that? When cars that cost 4 grand one year seemed to jump to 14 grand the next? All old hat now; a car -- a real car -- goes for $20,000 or more. Anything below that is just transportation. O.K., then, are you ready for label shock? If you like fine wine and are thinking of laying in a few bottles of something decent, you could be in for a few surprises. Prices are up, and they are going higher. Especially for higher-end California wines.
abstract: Frank J Prial wine column warns of label shock as prices rise, especially for higher-end California products; points to demand for fine red wines among American consumers, as well as phylloxera insect attacks that have wiped out hundreds of acres of prime West Coast vineyards over last several years (S)

headline.main: Good Taste Has Its Price (And It's Up)
